Class GameLogic

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameLogic
  • public class GameLogic
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements the logic behind a game of TicTacToe. The class has the following functionalities: check if a move is valid. check if a winning move has been made or the board is in a state of a draw.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Yves Br√§ndli, Nadine Moser, Robin Meier

    • Method Detail

      • validateMove

        public boolean validateMove​(int field,
                            java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> fields)
        Checks if move inputed is valid, following these rules: An input must be a value between 1-9. An input is not allowed in a field, which is already filled.
        Parameters:
        field - indicates the field in which the players desires to set her moves.
        fields - gets the corresponding value for the fields of the gameboard.
        Returns:
        the information, if the move is valid or not with a boolean.

      • checkGameState

        public int checkGameState​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> fields,
                          int turnCount)
        Checks for either a winning gamestate for each player or a draw. Returns an int for each Player winning or a draw, corresponding the following values: 0 = not yet finished 1 = draw 2 = Player one wins 3 = Player two wins
        Parameters:
        fields - gets the corresponding value for the fields of the gameboard.
        turnCount - the information, which players turn it is.
        Returns:
        the winningstatus as an integer.
